channel.title: Comments on: Five Year Anniversary of this Blog
channel.description: notes on Jewish theology and spirituality

item.title: By: Anna
item.dc:creator: Anna
item.description: Congratulations on your 5th anniversary. I think your blog is fantastic and I have never been disappointed when reading a new contribution. You take me to places I would never have anticipated and you don't patronise your readers. May you go from strength to strength. If you are ever teaching in Europe, please mention it in a blog, it would be nice to attend a class if possible.
item.content:encoded: Congratulations on your 5th anniversary. I think your blog is fantastic and I have never been disappointed when reading a new contribution. You take me to places I would never have anticipated and you don’t patronise your readers. May you go from strength to strength. If you are ever teaching in Europe, please mention it in a blog, it would be nice to attend a class if possible.

item.title: By: Alan Brill
item.dc:creator: Alan Brill
item.description:
In reply to <a href="https://kavvanah.wordpress.com/2014/09/12/five-year-anniversary-of-this-blog/#comment-11804">Larry Yudelson (@yudel)</a>.
I only have so much time. And in the end, when I did 3-4 short posts on the same topic people wanted them combined.It is not about hit counts. When I wrote only for friends and former students, I could explain things in a line, now with a wider readership posts are misread if I do not take the time to articulate what I want to say. People prefer me once a week (or twice) so they can think about it., rather than having to bookmark me in Pocket and never get back to it.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Larry Yudelson (@yudel).

I only have so much time. And in the end, when I did 3-4 short posts on the same topic people wanted them combined.It is not about hit counts. When I wrote only for friends and former students, I could explain things in a line, now with a wider readership posts are misread if I do not take the time to articulate what I want to say.
People prefer me once a week (or twice) so they can think about it., rather than having to bookmark me in Pocket and never get back to it.

item.title: By: Larry Yudelson (@yudel)
item.dc:creator: Larry Yudelson (@yudel)
item.description: So nu? Post what you read too! Surrender not to the god of ratings and hitcounts and likes!
item.content:encoded: So nu? Post what you read too! Surrender not to the god of ratings and hitcounts and likes!
